ai_insight.summary: Silvia Jones experienced two severe hyperglycemic events on 11/19/25, with glucose readings peaking at 455 mg/dL and 425 mg/dL post-meal. Despite taking correction doses of Humalog, her glucose levels remained high. Her average glucose over the past 7 days has been 185 mg/dL, with only 20% time in range. Recent labs show an A1C of 9.2%.
key_points: Bullet point 1: Two severe hyperglycemic events on 11/19/25, with BG levels >400 mg/dL.
Bullet point 2: Humalog correction doses post-meals have been ineffective.
Bullet point 3: A1C at 9.2% as of 10/15/25 indicates poor glycemic control.
Bullet point 4: Only 20% time in glucose range over the past week.

other_relevant_info: Recent high carb meals contributing to glucose spikes

timeline.details: Potato soup, tomato meatball pasta, garlic bread

suggested_messages.message: Hello Silvia, we've noticed your glucose levels have been significantly high after your dinners, especially on 11/19. Can we discuss your current meal plan and insulin dosing? It's important for us to tackle these high readings together.
suggested_messages.rationale: Addressing the patient's recent severe hyperglycemic events and the need to review her meal plan and insulin dosing to improve glycemic control.

suggested_messages.message: It's also essential to consider the timing and dosage of your insulin around meals. Let's explore carb counting as a strategy to match your insulin dose to your carbohydrate intake more accurately.
suggested_messages.rationale: Educating the patient on carb counting to enhance insulin dosing accuracy and improve postprandial glucose control.

suggested_messages.message: Patient experienced two hyperglycemic events >400 mg/dL on 11/19. Suggest reviewing her insulin regimen and considering a referral to a diabetes educator for carb counting training.
suggested_messages.rationale: Clinical rationale for adjusting the patient's insulin regimen and providing additional diabetes education to prevent future hyperglycemic events.

protocol_steps: Step 1: Review recent BG data and confirm medication adherence.
Step 2: Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia.
Step 3: Schedule a follow-up appointment with Onduo MD or Pharmacist within 7 days to review insulin regimen and consider medication adjustments.

clinical_assessment.trends: Worsening glycemic control indicated by recent A1C and frequent hyperglycemic episodes.
recommendations: Diabetes education on carb counting and meal planning

relevant_data_points.significance: Indicates severe hyperglycemia requiring immediate attention and intervention.
Reflects poor glycemic control over the past 2-3 months.

protocol.content:
Task: REVIEW BG \> 400
Code: BGM-104
Priority: P1
Program: lightpath
Trigger: BGM
Criteria: Triggered when a member has had 1 or more \[BGM \> 400 mg/dL in the last 24 hours\]
Steps (general): RN Review BG data, if available  Ask about medication adherence *We would like to support you with getting your glucose readings into range. Can you share with me if you ever forget to take your medications? If yes, how often have you missed a dose in the last week?* Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh) Review readings and check to see if member had a recent visit with Onduo MD to determine if a patient case is needed **No** patient case needed if: Participant has a visit scheduled with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the next 7 days  Participant had a visit with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the last 14 days and meds were adjusted  If a participant shares that they have not filled their Rx yet, no patient case is needed If single reading of greater than 400 but there is a repeat reading within 5 minutes of \<180 in range Resolve the to do (no note needed). **Yes** patient case is needed: create a ‘custom to do: follow up on trigger’ and schedule out 3 days  Once info has been collected from participant or it has been 3 days create the patient case in Athena and include any details you have for the MD If participant responded with info: Add to the ‘Current Medications’ section of patient case (within the macro) If member does not respond with info: Add to the ‘Current medications’ section of the patient case ‘No response from member about meds’ or ‘Member is not responding to messages’  Add a Note in Lightpath S: Symptoms/ causes O: BG:  A: NA P: Indicate that an Athena patient case was created and no action needed or a ‘plan’ for the HC with specific recommendations. [CS Athena Job Aid ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WwTMOMVY5IQw83Karzoj7158AnFFQx7CzpLULdBMXQc/edit#)
Roles: HC, PharmD, RN
